abstract: <jats:title>Abstract</jats:title><jats:p>In the 33 years since the first diagnostic cancer predisposition gene (CPG) tests in the Manchester Centre for Genomic Medicine, there has been substantial changes in the identification of index cases and cascade testing for at-risk family members. National guidelines in England and Wales are usually determined from the National Institute of healthcare Evidence and these have impacted on the thresholds for testing <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> in Hereditary Breast Ovarian Cancer (HBOC) and in determining that all cases of colorectal and endometrial cancer should undergo screening for Lynch syndrome. Gaps for testing other CPGs relevant to HBOC have been filled by the UK Cancer Genetics Group and CanGene-CanVar project (web ref. <jats:ext-link xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" ext-link-type="uri" xlink:href="https://www.cangene-canvaruk.org/">https://www.cangene-canvaruk.org/</jats:ext-link>). We present time trends (1990–2020) of identification of index cases with germline CPG variants and numbers of subsequent cascade tests, for <jats:italic>BRCA1</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>BRCA2</jats:italic>, and the Lynch genes (<jats:italic>MLH1</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>MSH2</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>MSH6</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>PMS2</jats:italic>)<jats:italic>.</jats:italic> For <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> there was a definite increase in the proportion of index cases with ovarian cancer only and pre-symptomatic index tests both doubling from 16 to 32% and 3.2 to > 8% respectively. A mean of 1.73–1.74 additional family tests were generated for each <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> index case within 2 years. Overall close to one positive cascade test was generated per index case resulting in > 1000 risk reducing surgery operations. In Lynch syndrome slightly more cascade tests were performed in the first two years potentially reflecting the increased actionability in males with 42.2% of pre-symptomatic tests in males compared to 25.8% in <jats:italic>BRCA1/2</jats:italic> (<jats:italic>p</jats:italic> < 0.0001).</jats:p>

assertion.name: Ethics
assertion.value: DGE has received consultancy fees from Astrazeneca and EverythingGeneticLtd.
